{{coord|50.707|-3.540|display=title|region:GB_scale:5000}} {{Refimprove|date=July 2009}} {{Infobox UK school | name = West Exe Technology College | image = | size = | latitude = | longitude = | dms = | motto = | motto_pl = | established = | approx = | closed = | c_approx = | type = [[Technology College]], [[Vocational College]], Leading Edge College, Applied Learning College, [[High Performing Specialist School]] | religion = | president = | head_label = | head = Steve Maddern | r_head_label = | r_head = | chair_label = | chair = Paul Smith | founder = | founder_pl = | specialist = | street = Hatherleigh Road | city = [[Exeter]] | county = [[Devon]] | country = [[United Kingdom]] | postcode = EX2 9JU [http://www.westexetc.devon.sch.uk/about.html School Website:About Us] | LEA = Exeter | ofsted = yes | urn = 113505 | staff = | enrollment = 1291 | gender = Co-educational | lower_age = 11 | upper_age = 16 | houses = Grandisson, Briwere, Temple, Pelham, Curzon | colours = | publication = | free_label_1 = | free_1 = | free_label_2 = | free_2 = | free_label_3 = | free_3 = | website = http://www.westexetc.devon.sch.uk/ | website_name = www.westexetc.devon.sch.uk }} '''''West Exe Technology College''''' is one of the five secondary schools in [[Exeter]], [[Devon]], [[England]]. West Exe was previously known as St Thomas High. The catchment area for the school is the [[St Thomas, Exeter|St Thomas]] area, [[Alphington, Devon|Alphington]], and some parts of [[Exwick]]. A new school building was opened in 2006, with the old being demolished. The head-teacher is Mr Steve Maddern; Deputy Headteachers are Mrs Vicki Carah, Mrs Beverly Maddern and Mr Rick Jolley. The assistant Headteachers are Mrs Julia Green and Mr Andrew Till. == Events in 2008 == Events included 'Whole School Learning Days', where students participate in activities such as team-building, problem solving, mind developing and fun educational activities. Other events included the concert on the 20th May which featured the West Exe Jazz Band, a string quartet and a Samba band. The concert raised money for Malawi. "Bike It" week included encouraging more pupils to ride their bike to school, bike safety lessons and bike agility courses. == Charity work== Each year the school chooses a chosen charity as well as a fund raising target which they hope to achieve. During the year they raise money for the charity in many events including charity week. 2006 - 2007 = ELF (Exeter Leukemia Fund)
2007 - 2008 = Malawi
2008 - 2009 = Devon Air Ambulance
2009 - 2010 = Help for Heroes
2010 - 2011 = Keyo Secondary School
Each charity and target is chosen by the students at the start of the year. == Senior prefects == (Sept 2009 - July 2010) Head Boy - Jake Hendy (House: Briwere)
